byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Baghdad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: American soldier is killed during operation to free prisoners of Islamic State, first casualty for United States since military re-entered conflict in region in 2014; officials claim mission involving US troops was exception made to support Kurds, and deny American troops will regularly see combat.
lead_paragraph: The slain soldier was the first American killed in action in Iraq since the withdrawal in 2011.

headline.main: U.S. Soldier Dies in Raid to Free Prisoners of ISIS in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Soldier Dies in Raid to Free Prisoners of ISIS

snippet: The slain soldier was the first American killed in action in Iraq since the withdrawal in 2011.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
